intro: Capnoides vernyi, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and often branched. Capnoides vernyi is often found growing in rocky or forested areas, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
